title: Writers block is a nocebo
excerpt: When we avoid jumping into a pool because it’s cold, we just say “the pool’s cold.” And when we pass up going to the gym because it we’re lazy, we simply say, “I don’t feel like it."

Writers block (or any other creative block) is a story we tell ourselves that lets us off the hook. A seemingly harmless phrase we use to guard ourselves against overcoming the inertia of jumping back in.
